q: The Times begins its story with Donald Rumsfeld 's account about being told by George W. Bush two weeks after the 9/11 attacks, to prepare review the Pentagon's plans for a war with Iraq. According to the Times: "Two weeks after the worst terrorist attack in our nation's history, those of us in the Department of Defense were fully occupied, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld recalls. But the George W. Bush insisted on new military plans for Iraq, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld writes. "He wanted the options to be` creative." ' " Reactions are starting to come in

Pero nunca vi la menor indicaci?n de eso afirma Donald Rumsfeld , quien al contrario, asegura que Colin Powell nunca present objeciones durante reuniones de gabinete y cre?a, como el resto del gobierno, que Saddam Hussein ten?a un arsenal de armas de destrucci?n masiva.
